snippet: When the British tax authorities struck a landmark deal with the Swiss to crack down on tax evasion, they sat back and waited for the cash to flow in. Almost three years later, they are still waiting.
abstract: British tax authorities have collected only about $1.7 billion of $8.4 billion windfall they once expected from landmark deal with Switzerland to crack down on tax evasion; deal is emerging as cautionary tale for growing number of nations that are feeling pinch of Europe's flat economy and are desperate to reap revenues from secret accounts held by wealthy.

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and DOREEN CARVAJAL

lead_paragraph: When the British tax authorities struck a landmark deal with the Swiss to crack down on tax evasion, they sat back and waited for the cash to flow in. Almost three years later, they are still waiting.

headline.main: Britain Fails to Find Riches It Expected in Swiss Accounts
headline.print_headline: Britain Fails to Find Riches It Expected in Swiss Accounts
